noun.description: A public sale in which goods or property are sold to the highest bidder.
examples: the books are expected to fetch a six-figure sum at tomorrow's auction

verb.description: Sell or offer for sale at an auction.
examples: his collection of vintage cars is to be auctioned off tomorrow

origin: Late 16th century: from Latin auctio(n-) increase, auction, from the verb augere to increase.
